author: @Peter_Anthony283
text: It's great that there's social cohesion and a social conscience being played out. Venezuela is a land that has experienced unending wealth and the potentials are off the charts, just by organisation and fair distribution through political will. Obviously, Utopian Socialism has always held the highest standards and Venezuela can breed that culture for the future and with success as leaders, so will come followers... No pressure then :)

author: @antirracistaproinmigrantes
text: In Venezuela there is no real socialism. Venezuela is not a dictatorship as the ignorant anti-communists claim, but it's not a truly socialist country either. Venezuela has a Keynesian  economy with many problems of corruption and bureaucracy. I don't read answers.

author: @thepeopleslibrary8673
text: You guys would consider this a Non-Marxist Socialist Experience? I would still argue their State is a Bourgeois State, but with a highly organised working class.

replies.author: @Sid_Hatfield
replies.text:
I wouldn't call it a bourgeois state, because the bourgeois doesn't control the arms of the state.
However, the decadent criminal bourgeois ruling class, in Venezuela, still exists and still hasn't been dispossessed, and is still a thorn in the side of proletarian organization. 
But then, no state on this planet had completely done away with its bourgeois elements.

replies.author: @antirracistaproinmigrantes
replies.text: And you should go to Haiti, which due to deregulated capitalism is in a much worse situation than Cuba. I don't read answers.

author: @waspwrap1235
text: Venezuela isn‚Äôt socialist, Hakim makes a decent argument why

replies.author: @distortiontildeafness
replies.text:
What are they considered ?  Honestly I think what we saw in the 20th century was just a glimpse of what socialism can look like.. I consider 20th century socialism a beta version if anything.   Unlike the right insists, there's no reason why the 20th century was the end alm and be all of a socialist era , if anything it was a fetal stage.

Which leads me to today's context.   We see capitalism is still the dominant global economic system.. rhe few countries that go against the grain that are considered "socialist " are really proto socialist if anything.   Would venezuela fall under this category ?  Curious to see hakim video on venezuela cause I noticed it's not often considered the main 5 that often acknowledged as such (ie.  DPRK, Cuba,Laos, China and Vietnam )

author: @franklinmemet
text:
This isn‚Äôt the utopia we as marxists should be pointing towards. Venezuela is an extremely anti-democratic, violent, and oppressive nation. 

I implore that you remove this so as not to send the wrong message to those learning about the teachings of Marx. 

For you guys (presumably westerners) to go to Venezuela and claim to see some sort of visionary form of socialism is just plainly ignorant and only reinforces the same inequitable asymmetries that we see between core and periphery nations. 

Marxism should be normalised, failed autocratic states should not.
